My only complaint is that the shaping darts in the front are sewn badly. The top point of this dart should end at the apex of the breast, and it ended 2" higher than the underarm seam. (Not even a 14 year old has "girls" that perky! haha).  I was able to re-sew this to make it less awkward looking.

The stitching for the cuffs and collar are well done and clean.

I purchased one of these for myself and one for my father to replace our silicone bands on the Pebble watches. At first it appeared to be sturdy and well made, and mine held up well for nearly a month. My father's locking pin eventually bent and I figured it wasn't a big deal, I nearly ordered another one. Two days later the locking pin on mine broke while at work, falling inside of a pipe full of 480 volt wires that feed electricity to a supermarket. While they were not energized and I was able to fish it out, this could have caused a severe issue and failure of the system. Now perhaps this is my own fault for trusting this watch band in such a situation, but I have worn watches for years and never damaged one or caused a band to break, and I don't believe I did anything to cause that here. It simply failed and I will be purchasing a proper watch band now.
summary: Bought Two, Both Broke in Under a Month

Looks good and fit pretty well.  It wasn't as comfortable as my original band for my TicWatch2, but it's not too bad.  The color more closely resembles a black with a dark yet shiny grey, so it ultimately looks like a somewhat shiny black. The clasps are anodized black. Either way it's a nice compliment to a matte black face.
The band holds firmly.  It came with traditional pins rather than the pins used with most smartwatches.  But that just means the band can be used with traditional as well as smartwatches.  The downside is that removing the band isn't as quick as simple as with other normal smartwatch bands.  But then again, I bought this band for long term use, rather than to swap the bands every other day.
For adjusting, the band had pre-existing notches, but there are enough for anyone to find a suitable size for their wrist.  The latch was quite tight, but then again, you're only going to adjust this one, maybe twice, so it's not a big deal.
summary: Looks good, fit well. Quite nice

I'll qualify that my 2 stars is a reflection of what happened with my band.  I had this band on a LG G Watch for approx 21 days.  I will state that I am a very "fidgety" person with watch bands and so I was adjusting the band clasp more then the average person probably would.  That being said, in less then a month the clasp "hook bar" bent making the watch completely unusable.  Basically the latch has two components, a bar that it hooks over and then an actual receiving hole/plug connection.  It needs to be securely on both to give it the tension to clasp and stay in place.  On my particular band because that little bar bent slightly, the clasp can now "flex" which causes the hole/plug connection to no longer be secure.  You GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR, I'm not mad or anything I just want to give some voice for those considering this band that yes, at this price, your going to get something of lower quality...  Moving on from the band FAILING.  It wore fine, I enjoyed it.  I have sensitive skin so any kind of rubber or leather band doesn't work.  Traditional steel bands don't work for me because of the lack of fine adjustability (again I'm fidgety) so this is a great compromise.

If your going to buy one, be very mindful when making adjustments to the clasp.  You have to use force to get the "teeth" to let go but if you use too much force you will ultimately bend or damage the clasp.  I've owned plenty of watch bands and never had this issue, it simply comes down to at this price point your getting something that is going to be relatively (to the price point) flimsy and you need to treat it as such.  In my case I probably made far too many adjustments in such a short time and weakened the metal to the point it bent.  Buyer beware of that is all.
summary: It wore fine, I enjoyed it

reviewText:
If you can wait a month for it to arrive, this is one nice watchband.  The finish is almost satiny, like a seat belt but made from stainless steel.  The band is easily adjusted by inserting a screwdriver into a slot in the clasp and prying it up.  Reverse the process to lock it down again at the ideal length.  Don't know how well it will hold up in the long run, but after a week there are no scratches in the finish.

UPDATE 3/12/15:  Two months later and it's still looking nice.  The finish has held up - no scratches or worn through spots - and the band material itself still looks like new.  I really like the fact that it is easy to clean, so it hasn't given me that dreaded sour watch band odor.  A little Dawn once a week keeps it nice and shiny.  Well worth the $5 I spent!  I hope it holds up until I get my Pebble Time Steel in July.  It'll make that watch look extra sharp.

UPDATE 3/30/16:  Over a year later and the band is still looking nice!  I wear it 24/7 except for the hour I charge the watch every 4 days.  There band still looks black and satiny, and the buckle still works perfectly although it does have a few scratches and a small dent (don't know how I managed that!).  I see that the price went up, but it's still 5-star in my book!
summary: Nice watchband.  Can't go wrong for the price if you can wait 30 days to receive it.

I had to buy a Dremel and cut away a rather large amount of the inside underarm away to make it fit even uncomfortably. At the widest point, my bicep is approximately 14.5 inches in diameter. The overall size and length of the arm makes it obvious it's intended for adult/teen use. It's like shoving a straight line through an L shaped one.

Without modification, this isn't going to fit many men who aren't smaller than average or at least have somewhat slender biceps. The overall design and durability is fine, although I will have to touch up some of the lines on the arm that weren't cut well. whoever designed it obviously didn't put much thought to it's comfort or how it actually slides up onto the arm. The opening is just too small. The extra space on this inside of the arm is completely pointless with the opening being so small. If it were $50 cheaper I wouldn't mind so much, but as it is the quality does not match the price.

I would only suggest buying this if you're either on the small side or willing and able to modify it.
summary: Inseam of arm opening is far too small!

reviewText:
I spent a lot of time debating on weather or not to buy this product for my Winter Soldier Cosplay outfit. With the price tag I had two major concerns, first was weather or not it would actually look like the picture, which it does indeed. The Arm is made of a hard and durable plastic (with the paint it looks enough like metal), the paint job is ok (The red star isn't perfect but you wouldn't notice from a distance and could easily be fixed up, the rest is great), and the detail of the molding is Fantastic! Based on that I would give it 5 stars.

However my 2nd concern was weather of not it would fit. I am 5'10" with a muscular build. I believe the molding was made for some one shorter (with shorter arms). It is difficult to shove the top part all the way on, and the way its made the shoulder sticks out noticeably to fare (I think that would be an issue for almost anyone who bought this for most body types). If the materials it was made out of were more flexible I think these would be less of an issue. Also, if the plastic was less sturdy it might be easier for fix for each individual after purchase.

All in all, it is a Great looking product, and I am able to shove it on my arm (through some discomfort and lack of mobility while wearing it). If I had the right tools and butter personal crafting skills I could probably fix it to make it fit better.
summary: Looks Great! Sturdy Material! but.... doesn't fit so well....

reviewText: I am in LOVE witht his corset.  I have had multiple corsets in the past, and have learned to find good ones.  The steel boneing is incredible, and is very comfortable to wear.  My only problem is I with the tie was a longer.  I'll probably be replacing that in the future.  I get so many complements on it when I wear it out.  Make sure you go exactly as the guide says.
It was too small and tight
Awesome thank you

I was quite skeptical about purchasing a corset online due to sizing issues and questionable quality but after receiving my order, I'm quite impressed. Not only is it real steel, it's incredibly comfortable. It has significantly helped my lower back pain from poor posture. I have the hour glass figure naturally but this enhances it. My only problem is it's too small for my hips but that's just what happens when you have a small waist and big hips. The corset itself seems to be of excellent quality (for the price) and I will definitely be buying more from this seller. Very, very impressed.

Beware of reviews telling you to go bigger; you need to measure yourself or have someone do it and buy the size corresponding to that number, or an inch or two smaller if you are trying to waist train.  I went up a size because of the reviews, and it is actually too large.  By which I mean that it fits me now, but I can't really cinch it.  In order to cinch your waist even a little bit (the reason most people want corsets), you have to have a corset small enough to be tightened at the back. So if you measure yourself perfectly, you need to make a purchase that has the capacity for tightening an inch or so. The back has a flap under the drawstrings (against your skin) that is a couple inches long, so that your skin under the drawstrings isn't exposed if the edges of the corset don't touch, which is nice.  This is a great quality buy for the price. But size yourself intelligently!

The order size is a little off.  Thanks to a review I read I ordered a size smaller than was suggested and I'm glad I did. I've only been using the corset for less than 1 week.  At first it was difficult to put on and tighten and was very uncomfortable to wear.  Took a couple of days to get adjusted.  I'm actually pleased with the corset.  I wear it at least 8 hours a day.  I tried wearing it at night but it was too uncomfortable. Some websites suggest not wearing the corset at night and others say it's ok.  I guess it's your preference.  I wear it as soon as I wake up in the morning and adjust it throughout the day (tightening/loosening).  I haven't had it long enough to see any results but I have a feeling it was worth the buy.
summary: Thanks to a review I read I ordered a size smaller than was suggested and I'm glad I did

I love it! So far it works it's comfort strong and really cute

I bought this for my submissive wife and she looks phenomenal in it. She has a relatively pronounce hourglass figure and the corset fits well. She wears a size 8 dress and i bought the 26" corset. Initially it could barely be tied but a week later and it fits well. It should be cinched first thing in the morning before eating. Between the corset, a diet of of vegetables and pastured meat with little to no grain and 3x week strength training the inches are melting off. Keeping your sub laced is fun control play too, the best of both worlds. Also if you wearing a corset you should def work your core, If your capable of using an ab wheel they can't be beat . In just a week she is looking better then she has since we had kids. For the price this is a very nice corset, once this can be laced closed I will invest in a nice handmade one through etsy.
Perfect!  I wore this under my mermaid fitted wedding dress and it did wonders!

For the price the quality is great.  I do not believe it is steel boned, because it's very bendable. But, honestly I am not sure. This is my first time. I am new to waist training. I've done a lot of research, so I know there are better corsets out there but they cost so much more. In my opinion, I felt  that this is great for someone trying out waist training for the first time because if it is something you may not like at least you didn't invest a whole lot. I don't regret this buy, in fact I recommend it. But please remember I'm new to waist training so I can be wrong. If it's not steel boned than will it work for waist training, I don't know.  With that said, it is the first day. I gotten mine within a week, weeks before expected- always a plus. Not sure if this will help also, but as for sizing I did go a size smaller than my natural waist measurement. I hope I was able to answer questions you might have had, and guided you the right way for whatever you ended up deciding.

reviewText: This is my review for the same sock brand and size but in a different pattern, my original review with pictures is here on this page Deer Mum Girl's Lovely Cotton Fruit Pattern High Knee Socks 8 Pairs These socks are really great and exactly what I was looking for. I bought these to be worn with cowgirl boots for my daughter, they come just above the boots on her leg and right below her knee. I ordered the size S 3-6Y for my daughter who is 3 years old, about 37 inches tall, weighs 29lbs and her shoe size is a 9 (toddler). I imagine these would easily fit up to a few sizes larger because they are so stretchy and the heel goes slightly past my daughters. These socks are very soft and very stretchy, my daughter has no complaints while wearing them, she actually loves to wear them around the house. The designs are cute and vary enough so that they don't all look alike. I will certainly be buying more of these "boot socks". Pros: Super soft and stretchy Knee-high Good price Cute designs Cons: They do not have non-slip bottoms They come held together in pairs with little metal clips at the toes that could be a choking hazard and an ouch if stepped on. My daughter pulled one off and my husband was the unlucky one that stepped on it. This does not impair the function of these socks at all, just wanted to note it.
summary: What you need to know before you buy

I'm deciding to repair it with my sewing machine and continue wearing it since it would be a costly return to China. I don't mind that it is snug. Keep in mind (cons):
1. It's quite small.
2. You will need to reinforce the seams.
3. It comes from China (long shipping time).
4. You probably need to wear it over a layer of clothing (not very comfortable next to skin).

I really wanted to like this dress. The print and fit looks extremely cute in the picture. The estimated shipping was supposed to take a month and it arrived only about a week after I ordered it, so I was very pleased with that. However, when I opened the dress the colors just didn't do it for me. When I opened the package and pulled out the dress, my friends little sister commented that it looked like something an 8 year old would wear. The twig design looked very gold and less brown than in the picture. The material is similar to that of a swimsuit, which I thought was okay but I think it would be better in cotton. The biggest problem was the length. I'm about 5 ft 3 and 110 lbs and this dress almost came down to my knees. By looking at the picture I expected it to be about finger tip length. I'm a junior in high school and I would see other options before buying this dress. It was made well, and the service was great, but it's just not for me. The print and material honestly reminds me of China (in person). However, when buying a dress for cheap, you can't expect too much. Like I said, I really wanted to like this dress, but I like it a lot better on the model than I do in person.
summary: Looks better online, but fast shipping and good price.

reviewText: This hat arrived at my house after much anticipation and when I touched the package I felt all the hairs on my entire body stand with an electric jolt of fear and excitement. I wasn't sure what was coming next but I knew I had to open this package immediately and place this item atop my head before a fate worse than death met me. I placed this cap of the Gods upon my head and took a deep breath as a universal power unlike anything I had ever felt before enveloped my body whole. It instantly fused with my head and intertwined with my soul as we became one. Everywhere I go people stop and stare and fall to their knees in my presence as they behold the splendor and glory that is now me with this hat. With this hat I can accomplish anything, I am no longer a mere homosapien; but something more, not of this world. I walk with Gods now on sunny beaches made of golden sand...and peasants. With this One True cap I have achieved immortality.

OMGoodnessss these pajamas are to freakin cute! Fits perfectly. I usually wear a size XL but after reading the reviews I decided to get a L. One of,if not the best,the most cool onesies you'll ever own. I so much love the drop seat so much better than the vertical flap. I'd hate to try to remain wearing one with a vertical flap while trying to use the toilet. I'd more than likely not make it on time, LOL It does have a internal flap to prevent accidental viewing of your bottom though. Which isn't too bad,it can be pulled up and out of the way for using the bathroom and full access for your bottom. Very comfy to wear and the fabric is very stretchy so it will move well as you wear it. I wished they did them in other camo patterns though,like military camo in urban or digital or desert patterns. But this one is still very cool though. I will say that I have looked for many other drop seat onesie's and no other one out there is priced like this one. They all seem to be much more expensive and not as cool looking either. Plus these are a tad more expensive on the actual site for them as well. Slightly cheaper here on Amazon. But everybody needs one of these and they do make them for women and kids too. So enjoy.

It fit very well. A little loose in places but never too tight anywhere else. My problem is with the poor stitching and the cheapness of the material. For 40 bucks I would expect it to not be coming apart at the seams after one use. There were already a bunch of lose strings before he even put it on. So he wore it for a xmas party and it was cute and did its job. The butt flap was adorable. He couldn't wear it again though because it's literally falling apart and I doubt it would survive the washer.

I was expecting this, but I was hoping I'd be surprised. The dress looks cheap (makes sense because it was) and it was very thin (see-through). It may work on a very small teenager who is looking for an affordable prom dress - but the slit is high and may be a little provocative for someone young.

I ordered this dress online about 2 weeks before a dance, and was very happy with the price considering it was a floor-length gown. When I got it, it fit extremely well except it was see-through. I suggest wearing a very well-fitting bra that is neutral with your skin tone or red because it shows in the back. Also, I would not wear underwear with this because you can definitely see your underwear lines. I would suggest wearing pantyhose. Also, I'm 5'9" so it was about 3 inches under my knee but that was fine with me. You can pretty much rotate the dress to get the leg slit either on the front or side of your leg. Even though I am tall, the gown just barely swept the floor/ was 1 inch above the floor, so I could wear heels. I don't know why people are saying the gown was too short, it was fine. Overall, I was very pleased with the gown!
summary: Very thin fabric, but beautiful gown

reviewText: Its a very pretty dress. Fit perfectly, all tho didn't love the texture of the fabric.

The photo of the dress here on Amazon makes it looks like a dark red (at least to me), but in reality, it's super bright, TRUE, firetruck red. Very bold! I was expecting it to be darker, but it fit great and is well made. The fabric is thin and stretchy, but doesn't scream cheap. I ironed it and it looked plenty nice! I wore a pair of tights under the dress which worked just fine, or you could do some kind of spanx. Regular underwear won't work, it's too form fitting. I'm about 5'7", 125/130 pounds, and the medium fit well. It was plenty long (I needed heels), and the slit wasn't too high at all. This is a sexy, form fitting dress (it isn't very forgiving since it's tight and a thinner material)  but it's still modest with the high neck line. I received many compliments and am excited to wear it again!

After reading the negative reviews of how high the slit is and how thin the dress is - I still went ahead and ordered the red one for a fall wedding I was attending. I am 5'7" so I ordered a medium since I'm usually between a small and medium in other clothing. It fit perfect! The slit was not too high and the lace back and side cutouts were just right. I was able to wear Spanx to smooth out my body and you couldn't tell that I was wearing one. It really turns heads when you walk into the room yet sophisticated because the collar of the dress sits at the base of your neck. The heavy weighted material really makes you look flawless! I might just order the black one as well!
summary: Very nice dress for the price!

I have been wearing nose hoops for many years, and have always been on the lookout for the best-fitting nose ring. My roommate turned me on to the C-shaped nose hoop, which is much easier to put in and take out as compared to full circle hoops that require a lot of bending and what not to get in.
The package arrived on time, in a nice box for safe-keeping. I appreciate the variety in colors, as it is helpful to change out depending on the day. Everyone's nose is different and mine is definitely slimmer, so I found that straight out of the box the ring was a bit too wide for my nose to look normal. Luckily the metal is strong yet malleable, and I was able to easily bend the ring to fit exactly how I liked it in my nose. This is also useful when taking the ring out as well.
The only down-side to this type of nose ring is that, as it doesn't have anything really to hold it in place, that the flat portion destined to rest against the inside of your nose often shifts and is visible within your nostril with high activity. This is to be expected, however, with this style of ring and not a fault of the product itself. Just be aware it is not completely secure and can slide out from your nose to some extent. As a natural fidgeter, however, it is not difficult for me to adjust it throughout the day to ensure it stays in place. Even with that small downfall, this is the only type of nose ring I'd like to wear as it is easily removable for swapping and cleaning your face as well.
The included photo shows me wearing the black colored ring.
Overall, this is a quality product that has done well for me so far. I would suggest it to anyone and will purchase more in the future!

reviewText: Just the right size!

I typically don't write reviews, but I want to put in a buyer beware so people don't have the same experience. I was so excited to get these rings that as soon as I got them, I disinfected the gold ring according to the instructions my piercer gave me (I got my nose done 5 months before I got these, so the piercing was healed, but I was still maintaining contact with my piercer since I wanted to get pierced by her again at some point) and I put it in. I had issues with getting it to stay in, but other than that, I was over the moon. I started to notice some irritation towards the end of the day, but I assumed that it was just from me having to readjust it more than my neometal stud. But when I woke up the next morning, I was in excruciating pain. My nose was swolen and I realized that it had to be from the ring since I had never had any problems before and, like I said, it was a healed piercing. So, I ran into the bathroom to change it and between the time that I took out the ring and went to re-insert the stud, my nose had already started to close up. I essentially ended up having to re-pierce my nose. Now, I'm not sure if there was something wrong with the metal used or if I might have a metal allergy (I have my ears pierced though and have never had any problem with sterling silver). My main point of this is BE CAREFUL. If you think you might have a metal allergy, don't get these. If you have a new piercing, don't get these. Just be cautious.

reviewText: Love it!

Mudder's Big Style Hunger Game Bird Vintage Pocket Watch with Golden Dial has a great design, and lots of appeal for men and women alike.

The vintage style bird sits on an arrow at a really pretty angle on the front of the watch.
Additionally the case is beautiful.
The case is brass, and nicely chased, with a flower and vine design motif.

The inner works are easily accessed by popping open the face of the watch. They are charming in design. The colors are lighter and stand out nicely against the brass.

I think this is a very charming pocket watch.

It would make a lovely gift for a man or a woman.

It arrives ready for giving in a pretty dark bronze box with a velvet pillow inside for the watch to nestle on.

My Mudder's Big Style Hunger Game Bird Vintage Pocket Watch was easy to start (you just open the front of the case and set the dial).

I find it very unique. It is extremely attractive in design, and a nice sturdy watch as well.

I recommend this fanciful, special pocket watch.

I think anyone would enjoy it for its looks, and would appreciate the smooth, easy way that it works, as well!

Thank you,

jean!
summary: Nostalgic in sensibility,this fine looking pocket watch has lots of style!

They did, however, hurt my feet after wearing them for over 12 hours for the football game. Not a huge deal since it was my first time wearing them. These look much better in person. Inov-8 shoes are my absolute favorite. They are comfortable, high quality shoes that last. I have ran numerous OCR's in mine, while using them regularly at the gym and at work and they last much longer than the other popular shoe brands. I also love the attractive and functional minimalist soles and bright vivid colors. (I hate nothing more than the look of a big, clunky shoe sole). It's the only brand of athletic shoe I ever buy anymore, and I've tried them all. I own several pairs, and highly recommend.

reviewText: I really like these lightweight shoes for my crossfit WODS. Great shoe and very attractive!  A little big, and tends to stretch out fairly quickly.  But I also have small and narrow feet.  I usually wear a size 6 in street shoes, and 6.5 in gym shoes.  I did get this in 6.5, but maybe I should have sized down.  It's perfect for zumba or kickboxing!

Coming from wearing Metcons, they took some getting used to since they're so minimal, but I do love them. Anything involving CrossFit movements are easier because the shoes are so light, dubs, running, box jumps, anything. The ONLY complaint I have about them is that toe box is quite large ( have medium width feet) so I have to tie them fairly tight to get stability in my forefoot so it doesnt slide around too much. For as lightweight as the shoe is and as often as I wear them, they're not showing ANY hard ware on them as my Metcons did. I'd buy again though!

Here's the important distinctions between this and other Innov8s similar...
 I have 249's, they run small. The rest (185, 195) are true and I usually wear a 10 across the board in Innov8 workout sneakers for lifting. I don't have narrow feet but not wide either.  Like some room in the toe box but not too much.  I put my own insole in and wear them all day if needed.  Not sure what the P means but they seem to fit higher around the ankle than my others.  No big deal. I ordered a 10.5 since reviews indicated they ran small...not by Innov8 standards. Too big on me. But....

Here's my deal breaker... THE RED IS BRIGHT NEON PINKISH RED.  Very disappointing.  They are going back.

reviewText: I'm in this weird backwards Goldielocks situation with Inov-8 right now... This is the 3rd pair I've tried to buy from them. The 1st (one of their weightlifting shoes) fit perfectly, the 2nd (this same shoe but a men's version) was WAY to small despite being the correct size, and this pair, also technically the correct size, was WAY too big. I normally wear a 10.5 in athletic shoes, which is what I ordered, but this shoe was too wide and had almost a full inch of extra length in the toe box. I'm going to try once more but I'm REALLY starting to get frustrated here. They desperately need to update and standardize their sizing charts.

These are a great minimal shoe, but I needed something with a bit more sole, especially in the toe. Straight to the ground which is great if that is what you're looking for. They would be great for the gym, but I wouldn't recommend them for road running unless you have properly prepared for a minimal shoe.

reviewText:
I purchased these shoes for a Spartan race I did back in August.  They didn't provide the amount of traction I needed for that run, but weren't "slippery" by any means.  They are super comfortable for my flat feet, and cleaned up flawlessly after all the mud from the race.  I now use them as my go-to gym shoes because they have such a low profile and my feet feel firmly planted for weight lifting.  I would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a cross-training shoe that works for both running and the weight room.

They have already started coming apart near the toes, but I did put them through the ringer with the mud run...so I'm not sure if that's something to be shocked about.
The sizes didn't fit me too well, I ended up returning it, but for the right person and the right shoe inserts (like SuperFeet) they could be good.

The reason why I gave it a 4 star, is because it comes up higher on my ankle than my other innovates.  I would revert back to my other innovates once these get a few more miles on them.

Shoes are lightweight, highly responsive, and a good alternative to barefoot training. But great for shorter runs/sprints and all cross-training activities. Fit: I am a 7.5, but generally size up for athletic shoes. Read the reviews and listened. I'm a 7.5 and went wih an 8, perfect fit. I have flat feet, bunions, and plantar fasciitis. After I did t25 on running shoes, I was in extreme and constant pain. I work standing up in one position for 8 hrs a day. I'm doing p90x3, and tony mentions you shouldn't be using running shoes to workout. That's what led me to buy this shoe. After working out for 2 weeks using this shoe, I don't wake up with horrible pain and can walk around as soon as I wake up. The shoe is lightweight, and when working out or light running, I don't experience my usual horrific pain. So far so good.
The only thing I hesititate about is I can't wear too bulky socks or my feet feel like they're going to explode.

The only reason why I give these shoes four stars is because when I tried them at the store, they fit fine.  I ordered a size 8, though am a normal size 7.5.  I also have a very long middle toe (the one next to the big toe) and that's what made these shoes intolerable to wear.  I should have walked around with them in the house before going outside and I would have noticed my long middle toe hitting up against the front of the shoe.

It was very painful to walk in them because of the toe issue, the width is absolutely magnificent--lots of room to wiggle your toes.  That width is the only comfortable part.

I recommend ordering a whole size up.

reviewText: It is about five times SMALLER than shown in the photo.  The photo makes it appear as if it starts from the neckline down to your waist.  That is what I was counting on, for example, to wear with a white t-shirt.  It really appears to be a full bib necklace and I compared it with other photos and necklaces from the same company.  There are no dimensions listed, so we really have to rely on the photo which is extremely misleading.  I like everything about it other than that, but that is the most important feature and the only reason I bought it, for the size shown, as I was visualizing what it would look like on.  It may be too much trouble to return, so this is just for others....buyer be very aware of just how TINY it really is and seller, please use a more realistic photo and lose the one that falsely shows this as a much, much larger necklace.  I also bought the floral necklace from them and it was sized perfectly and shown as a true bib necklace.  It is just a problem with the way this one is extremely falsely advertised.  Happy shopping!! (My first Amazon review!  Wish I was able to give it a more positive one!)
summary: TODDLER-SIZED!  Much, much SMALLER than advertised and shown

Just received these and I'm beyond disappointed. I got them for my 12-year old son. In person they are VERY cheap looking. I know they're only $10, but I can stop at the mall or any drugstore and get better quality. The inside of the lenses are very sticky - so strange! Worst of all, the gold paint over the plastic frames is all scuffed up --- particularly on the arms of the glasses. It's like people have been wearing these for a year before they were mailed to us or maybe they fell off the conveyor belt in the Chinese factory they were made in (they're made in China) and kicked around on the factory floor for a while. Whatever it was, there was no quality control and they had no qualms about sending out very scuffed up frames (the lenses aren't scuffed but are entirely sticky on the side facing your eyes).

I would send these back in a second, but my son wants to keep them because he hasn't seen wide "gold" frames anywhere else and, frankly, it's not worth my time and trouble to send back $10 glasses or I would. I just threw away $10 on these. Everyone else...save your money!

I live in the south so there is a lot of bright sunshine here and I do feel so far that the lenses provide great coverage of the sun and also there is little no non glare effect on the lenses. The only negative I have run across so far is that the temples are a little difficult to open and close, which over time may be a good thing, but I do find myself struggling to open them to wear everyday.

I never used to write reviews for anything, but, as I've started to buy more clothes online I've come to really rely on the experiences of others.  I generally do not take time to return things I've ordered online which results in wasted money and a closet half full of ill-fitting clothes.  In the case of this dress, I got very lucky; there were no reviews on it previously so here is the first one.  I ordered a medium which is generally the size I wear.  My measurements are:  Bust:  35 1/2"  Waist:  29"  Hips:  39"  It fits  - like a glove as they say.  I don't mean that in the sense that it looks cheap and inappropriate - just that it just fits really close to the body, much as you see in the ad for the dress.  The material is not thick, it is a thinner, stretchy material, but it does not feel cheap.  It's a nice thin material that is comfortable for hot weather.  I would really recommend this dress - I'm very happy with it.  Based on the measurements I gave, if you like clothes that fit a little more loosely, I would definitely choose one size up.  Otherwise, if you want it to fit as you see it on the model in the ad then it's fairly true to normal sizing.
summary: Nice, cool dress.  Fits as expected.

Great product. Makes you 100% flat. I'd suggest ordering 1 to 2 sizes up, unless you're very small. Asian sizes tend to be smaller than American ones. I'm about 5'3 and 145 pounds, so if you're any bigger than that, the binder may not fit. In that case, you should order an official Underworks product or something similar if you've got the money for it. This binder is attached to a stretchy and breathable tank top, which is pretty comfortable. It's is a little thick, so it hurts my back a little, but I think it's because I need to break it in. However, it flattens me pretty well, so I'm not complaining too much. The only real complaint I have is that the binding part doesn't stay in place very well on the shirt, so it gets twisted sometimes and can be difficult to fix. I'd recommend hand washing it, if you can. Overall, I'd recommend this, especially if you're on a budget. You really get your money's worth.

...it has two shortcomings.  One, if you're small of stature you may find the cap large and puckers a bit in the back (top) when you try snugging it up. Two - and, ultimately, the most annoying aspect about the cap (which I failed to note when ordering!) - is the fact that the underside of the brim is white, and very reflective.  Wear it driving in a convertible on a sunny day?  Major distraction!  Wear it boating or fishing on a bright, sunny day?  Painful!  But the good news is that the mesh extends all around the cap, allowing for ample air circulation, which is why I wanted the cap in the first place.  So, it's become my go-to early-morning or in-the-dark dog-walking cap, keeping me safe from sleepy, inattentive motorists.  Yippee...

My husband is 5'9" and it was a bit baggy but that was fine as it gave him ample room to move around and to sit down and eat. I embellished the looks of the horse--cut off the yellow mane & tail and replaced it with white felt cuttings; horse's face looks angry so added long false eyelashes; printed out large blue eyeballs and pasted it over the pink eyeballs. This was worn to a very nice Kentucky Derby party where women wore gorgeous hats but my husband, a serious university professor, was a definite hit as a jockey. I also embellished a neon green workout shirt and added red large strips + got a white baseball hat and acrylic painted it in the same colors as the shirt.  Also, made a garland of roses wore over the horse's neck with a sign "Secretariat's Secret Off-Spring". Yes, the hat is useless. Steam pressing enhanced it. When it was dinner time, the battery unit (wish it weren't a bright orange so that it looked so obvious exposed on the behind) was turned off and it was easy to put the deflated head under the table to eat. It was great that inflating takes a short time, so he was ready to go in a short time. Your product added to a very festive evening. It was worthwhile to shop around because this same thing was selling as high as $85 at a costume store and from $45-$65 online and we bought it for $39.99. I was concerned that it  might not get to me in time so I paid $10 for shipping and was told that it'd arrive in 4 days at 8 PM and it arrived on a Sunday (4th day) at 5 PM.

This is an awesome costume! Last year my 4 year old grandson dressed in a similar costume for Halloween and wants to wear the same one this year. When I was offered this one at a discount for an honest and unbiased review, I decided it would be perfect as we can both go trick or treating on our "horses". It is relatively well made and is just too funny. I am a larger woman and am a bit over 5'7 so it is just a bit short but with brown boots, it is not noticeable (it IS a costume after all). The cowboy hat that comes with it is an added bonus (I have to buy one for my grandson now). I am looking forward to Halloween to wear this and surprise the little guys!
summary: Great costume and so much fun!

reviewText: Love it!!!!

I'm retired and live in my bathrobe on the days I don't expect company o plan to leave the house.  Imagine how embarrassing it is when the postman knocks on the door to deliver a package at noon and I'm still not dressed.  This lounger was the answer to my dilemma!  People have complained about flimsy fabric, shoddy stitching, poor fit and shrinking.  I ordered two in black, with a couple of months between orders, so they have been machine washed and dried many times and I have had no problems with quality or shrinking.  I absolutely love the large pockets, and can carry my phone around without worrying that it will fall out - what a pleasant change from the usual too shallow pockets on women's clothing!  For me, the sleeves touch as illustrated and that's not a bad thing.  I hate short sleeves, but they can't be more than a 3/4 sleeve or else they get in my way when I'm cooking.  The only thing I don't like about the dresses are those cheap looking buttons, but then I remember: it's a $20 house dress and I can always replace them myself.

I'm definitely ordering a #3, but I don't want a bright color.  I'd buy a color if they were muted.  Gray is my next choice, but it's not available in my size - so I'll wait.
Fabric is very thin for a lounger. More pajama weight.

To bottom line it, these are wonderful!  They are soft, comfortable. I have two and am planning on buying another lounger.  I wear this to the grocery store and have received compliments!  I can go walking outside in my lounger..you cannot see through it. The neckline is great and I like the slits on each side to move with ease. You cannot go wrong with this purchase!
summary: I  recommend to anyone who is in to comfort!

reviewText: This is a VERY nice flannel gown for the price.  I ordered two.  The flannel is thin but still quite warm.  The color (I bought pink) is pretty and it's very comfortable.  I recommend washing before wearing; they had a "dye" smell to them and washing removed the dye odor.  I washed them in cold water, delicate cycle, gentle detergent and dried on low.  I recommend sizing up as the nightgown does shrink a bit in the wash even using cold water as is common for 100% cotton clothing.  On me (I'm 5' 7") after washing/drying it hits about the middle of my calf.  I sized up two sizes as I like my sleepwear loose, but 1 size up would be good if you just want it to fit comfortably and not worry about shrinkage from laundering.
summary: Very nice flannel gown for the price

reviewText: I love, love, love this night gown. It is warm and comfortable! It fits as expected.
Very nice quality for the price

Ordered an M and an XL because I understood that these would shrink and knew ahead of time that I would be "working" on these to make them long enough to tuck your feet into.

Washed both gowns in warm/cold and dried warm/hot to get the most shrinkage before giving either as a gift.
The length drew up 2-3 inches from the length out of the package.
IMO, no excessive (for 100% cotton flannel) shrinkage otherwise, but you want nightgowns to be "roomy," so purchase accordingly.
I was skeptical about the eyelet being 100% cotton, but I think it may be. It looks good for it. I cannot speak for the thread that is a part of the eyelet, but it seems too shiny for cotton thread. The eyelet is nicer than expected.

The medium gown's "sweep" (hemline) measures 54" across (after laundering), and the XL is about three inches wider (about 57"). Compare this with the sweep of your favorite gown. To small a sweep gives you a "hobble" gown and you can trip yourself up in it.

The XL's laundered length is about an inch (yes, 1" only) longer than the Medium's laundered length, which is 47" from the nape of the neck to the hem at the back.

I am pleased with the weight of these and the fabric so far.

To create the length I need for these gifts, I am adding a ruffle in a solid flannel (prelaundered to shrink the fabric before cutting), using a 13" ruffle on the M for a 5'8" lady and a 9" ruffle on the slightly longer XL for a 5'5" lady.

The ruffle will be hemmed in the fabric of the original gown.

If you decide to go this far to make this gown work, you may want to see Mark Montano's "Make your Mark" sewing video "How to add a ruffle hem" for the principle of adding the ruffle and also have a look at "3 ways to gather" from Threads for the "hard" part. These are both on youtube. I prefer two gathering lines for prettier gathers, the second to sit virtually at the final seam line. For that method, the second video will be helpful.
summary: Nice, but some sewing required unless you are pretty short . . . .

reviewText: I absolutely LOVE this necklace!! I thought it might be cheap looking and feeling (based on the price), but I figured, "What the hell!" Anyway, it looks EXACTLY like the picture (even on a short neck, which I have), so I highly recommend it! To give more detail: Usually women with longer necks look great in any necklace, but sometimes (if you have a shorter neck), some styles just make you look wider or bulky. This doesn't do that at ALL! It actually elongated my neckline, and it has an adjustable clasp, so you tall-neck people can wear it, too! I know, I thought I could make you jealous by saying only short-necked people could wear it, but alas, I can't. Grrrrr! You tall, slender, elongated people look great in most anything!! Except mini skirts -- that is the short people w/ great legs domain!! I mean, you can try to show it off, but (let's be honest), you can't go too, too short. We totally can! Thank you, Karma, for ONE fashion advantage! ;)

First of all - lets level set your expectations.  It is a $3 necklace.....don't expect high end quality.  That being said, it seems to be well made.  It is definitely a statement piece so the trick is pairing it with the right outfit and mixing in some more expensive pieces to bring it up.  I wore a navy and white striped pencil skirt, a white sleeveless one button blazer (think suit jacket with no sleeves) and some brightly colored heels (my very expensive element).  The necklace was exactly the color I needed up top with my white blazer.  I got so many compliments on it...but didn't share my bargain secret!  With the wrong outfit, this would go very wrong.  With the right outfit, it is a fantastic deal!

reviewText:
Nice To look at: This can be a really nice necklace considering how cheap it is. The colors are vivid that they catch any form of illumination.

I would not wear it to fall directly onto a bare skin. There are some sharp edges that can poke the skin. I had to gingerly file down these sharp edges in the back of the necklace especially in areas where the sections are attached. I had to inspect carefully the closures and tighten them. There is a short extension (included) that is not tightly attached for closure. They fell apart when I took them out of the plastic bag. I reconnected them using a long nose pliers to get the clasps together and close the gaps. After doing all these, I tried it on wearing a thin sweater, there were still sharp edges that caught and pulled out the knitting of my sweater. I had to re-file it down again and again.

As long as you don't move too much, it is a nice piece to look at for display. It arrived very quickly. Wish the Sellers inspected these closely for quality.
summary: Nice To Display; Too Many Sharp Edges. You Have To Work On Them To Wear Without Getting Poked

reviewText: It not good quality, not as the pictures at all when I wear it !

I gave these tights only 1star because in the picture it makes it seem as though the shorts part (i.e. The part that's supposed to cover your crotch/butt area) is not see through, so that you can wear them like leggings. However, that is definitely NOT the case here. The shorts area are COMPLETELY see through, exactly as if you're wearing panty hose--And I don't mean see through as in only when you bend over, I am talking about 100% see through. Initially I bought these so I could wear them with a sexy top for when going to a bar or club or something bc I LOVE leggings so much, but the second I put them on, I realized I for sure could not do that with these bc of how see through they are. You can't even wear it with a shirt that has any slits at the side or high-low hems or anything bc not only is the area see through but they also have all these unflattering hemlines just like pantyhose! Therefore, unless your plan on wearing these with a dress or extremely long tunic shirt, I would definitely NOT recommend buying these tights.
Also the material of the tights are ok, the mesh part is very similar to panty hose material and the crisis-cross straps are made out of this shiny, silky, nylon material. Not my favorite, that's for sure. However, it did fit with a little extra room to spare, I'm 5'4" 125 lbs and they weren't big to the point of falling off but they also were not as tight as my other comfortable leggings. It would still be wearable for someone my size but it definitely feels like it could stretch more, so larger sizes would also fit them if they chose to buy it (which I wouldn't recommend)
summary: Poor quality and EXTREMELY see through at the top

Leggings look great when you try them on and are thin, but not see-through.  The bandaged areas are attached like flaps which looks funny at first, but it allows the leggings to be stretched to the desired look like in the picture.  My major gripe is I received the leggings and there's a big hole right in the middle of the crotch area.  It looks like someone tried them on and returned them and ripped a whole in them or someone took a pair of scissors and just cut right through it. I'm pretty upset I received damaged goods and that the item wasn't checked before mailed out.  Other than that, the leggings look great when on and is exactly what is pictured but you can tell the fabric is dyed because I noticed some black dye on my fingernails after putting them on.  It definitely has a chemical smell to it and I've read other reviews about how the leggings dyed their legs black, so... I'm not sure how confident I feel about wearing leggings like these.

These are probably good for wear a few times then toss them.  I only give it 2 stars because they look great and I received them within 2 days as promised, but I don't think these would hold up in the wash and if I'm getting dye on my fingernails already... I can't even imagine the headache it would be trying to get dye off my legs.  If someone finds another pair just like these but with better quality and workmanship, let me know!
summary: Received damaged goods; dye transfer on my fingernails

reviewText:
BUYER BEWARE!  This item comes from CHINA.  If it doesn't fit, you'll have to return it yourself for about $20 in postage.  I had no idea this came from China or that it couldn't be returned for a smaller size like some of the other purchases I made.  This is considered a "Marketplace" item and if you buy it, you are stuck with it.

That said, the top was very pretty but extremely sheer, but that didn't bother me, a cami would fix it.  I bought the black one, and it was pretty.  I based the size I ordered on previous recommendations, and I guess you need to consider this:  are you a normal weight for your size frame?  Then order what you normally order.  If you're 50 lbs. overweight, go up a size!
summary: DOESN'T FIT?  TOO BAD; TO RETURN IT WILL COST YOU MORE THAN YOU PAID FOR IT!

American Indian motif, including tribal regalia worn in dancing ceremonies, form the patterns on the cloth. I did not carefully view the print when ordering and when it arrived, even though the colors and design were attractive and flattering in the mirror, I would not wear due to spiritual "conflict of interest."  Love all American Indians.  Just cannot get into the spiritual liaison of the dances.

reviewText:
Awesome!  Lovely, loose, breezy and sharp looking.  Was the ideal top to tuck into a suitcase for a trip.  I wore it in the city for a night out, and it worked as a casual top around the beach.

The fit is expectedly loose and forgiving but with enough of band around the neckline and arm holes to make it a touch more polished than just a piece of material thrown about - very cute.

I received it quicker than expected, and will be purchasing more of these now that Spring and Summer are finally here again.

I haven't washed this yet... I will be handwashing as it seems quite delicate.  I'm hoping it stands the test of time, but at this price - it's a brilliant piece!
summary: Sharp looking comfortable cool top to pull your outfit together!

reviewText: This is such a great top and it's a favorite of mine now.  I plan on ordering more of this great casual style!

The blouse is actually quite well made and the fabric feels of much better quality that I expected for the price.  The only reason I'm not giving full stars is because the colors are not at all what I expected and I probably would not have bought it if I had seen it first.  In the photo the ground color looks like a teal with muted earth tones in the feathers. What I got is actually a bright shade of olive green and very brightly colored feathers, heavy on the mustard color, which doesn't look great on my skin tone.  The colors are a lot brighter than I would usually wear, although it would look great on darker skin tones than mine.  I think fading would improve this blouse and I'm hoping that the dye quality is not as good as the rest of the quality of the garment so that I can have what I want after several washings.

reviewText: Great Blouse!

I have ordered from this company before.  You can depend upon this particular style of shirt to fit most people up to a size of 2XL.  I feel that this shirt fits pretty good because it is actually a type of caftan, which are traditionally designed to be extremely baggy.  If it were not for that, this top would probably not fit a plus size woman.  I ordered this blouse with a different print twice before, and I was thoroughly satisfied.  On an American size 14-16, the sleeves stop short, just past the elbow, but does not extend to the wrist as shown on the model.  Of course this can be attributed to the fact that the model is probably a size 0-2 in American measurements.  Overall, I give this shirt a 5 because its cute, I can fit it comfortably, and you can't beat the price.  Happy hunting!

When ever I order from China, I'm always reluctant  of ordering my regular size (small), because I know that their measurements are different from ours. I have recently ordered a lot of little items coming from China.  I would warn anyone who is larger than a size 12, BE CAREFUL!  I have gotten lucky twice, when ordering from China, when I purchased two oversized batwing shirts.  However, I should have never purchased this maxi dress, or should have at least paid attention to the size of model depicted in this advertisement; as she is obviously a size 2.  I ordered the XL maxi dress, but it fits like a medium ( I know because I use to fit into a medium, but not any more). Something to watch for when buying from companies on Amazon,  the items may look similar,  but they may be from a different designer which means the material may be different from an item made exactly the same way which is the case with this item. I purchased this item in the color white and also in an xlarge..only difference?  The white one must have spandex because it fits like an xlarge..so make note of that...

Either way,  both items are nice...

Please sell these items I larger sizes and make sure buyers know all details before buying and also have a size chart for American buyers to convert the sizes..thanx

reviewText: Second pair. I love these. Comfortable and classic. I have a wide head and they still fit well without pinching. I bought a pair and a spare so I'm never without.

These glasses are really comfortable and inexpensive for the polarization. They seem very well made and there are no loose screws. They even included a blue pouch that doubles to clean your eyeglasses if they get smudgy. The polarization is really well done. They reduce the glare from the bright Californian Sun, and they look super cute when doing it.

I do take off one star though and that is because they are mirrored. The pictures that the seller uses make it seem that the lenses perhaps are grey/green, but the lenses really are a red/gold mirror. Some people may not like that and it makes me feel like an alien sometimes. It is a sporty type of lense so although function is great, I do not now how well it pairs with the retro/classic look.

Overall though I do recommend as long as you are paying attention to what you are getting with this product.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

reviewText:
This took a VERY long time to get to me (can't really complain when shipping is free), did not fit right, and was very cheap material. I am 105 lbs and a 34 B cup and went with the small; the bottoms fit (be advised they are granny panties) and the top was way too small. The top is very padded which is always nice to give a little extra boost but the shape was almost pointy and reminded me of something Madonna would wear, not really my style (this could just be because the top was to small). While this bathing suit does have some good qualities (the color and style are awesome) the bad for me out weigh the good. For how much this cost, it's almost worth it for me to buy a medium just for the top but I don't feel like waiting.

Also the straps are connected in the front similar to that of a strapless bra, where they can be un-hooked and come off but they are sewn in and connected in the back. The strap hooks were so cheaply made they keep coming undone in the front and when they are attached they pull up over the top of the bikini and are visible appearing like they are going to come free any minute. (This also could be because the top was too small for me).
summary: The bad out weigh the good

Very stylish, high quality leather, well made. I can't imagine a more premium wallet, which is good considering the price. It was a little larger than I expected. The full portion could fit a passport and other documents, without the take-out portion you could fit a large phone inside. For the full sized portion you will definitely need to carry it in a coat pocket or a small bag. The take-out portion works pretty well as a stand-alone wallet and also looks great, although the magnetic clasps that are supposed to keep it closed are too flimsy. As another reviewer noted, the slots for the cards are initially very snug. It will take maybe a month or more of regular use to break in the leather so cards slide in and out easily. Same is true for folding the take-out portion: if you have more than 2 cards or a lot of cash, it won't fold in half easily right away. But even though I just got this the leather looks good enough that I'm sure with use it will be easier.
summary: which is good considering the price

reviewText: This has been a very useful addition to my bag and wallet collection. I have too many cards and other things to fit into a streamlined wallet - but sometimes I need the streamlined wallet. This one fulfils both, so that I don't have to constantly switch from one wallet to another, I just take the inner wallet when I need a few things , and the whole wallet/bag when I need to have everything with me.  The inner wallet stays in place with magnets when inside the larger piece, and the same magnets help keep the insert wallet together when using it alone.  The leather is very soft, which could be a good thing or a bad thing. I like it, but would have also been happy with a less subtle leather too.  All in all my favourite wallet so far.  It was a little expensive but worth it for me.
summary: Very useful and practicle - and a quality product

reviewText:
My wife purchased this for me at my request. i was looking for a way to maintain far too many credit cards, receipts, bills, etc. etc. and yet have a small wallet for a few cards and some cash that I could carry on a daily basis. The Bellroy Take Out appeared to be an ideal solution.  Unfortunately, it wasn't.

The wallet itself is beautiful and the design is ingenious.  However, credit cards must be slightly smaller in Australia (where the wallet is made) than in the US. Trying to insert and remove cards was a frustrating, difficult experience. It could well be that the leather would have stretched sufficiently with use to eliminate the problem but I was concerned that the stitching would give out before the leather stretched sufficiently to make the wallet usable.

The smaller "take out" wallet was even worse in terms of the size of the slots. The end came when I discovered I would never be able to insert a standard size business card in one of the card slots in the small inner wallet.

I would have loved to keep the wallet. The workmanship and quality of the leather seemed superb. But the wallet simply failed to meet the basic requirements for storage and ease of use.
summary: Sadly, It didn't work for me.

reviewText:
I had the waterproof version of this wallet and the tape alongside the zipper failed in about one year of use.  Bellroy has an excellent 3-year warranty. Bellroy replaced my wallet with a newer version - the Elements Pocket Wallet.

I loved the original version of the wallet, but the new one is even better. There are definite improvements, including a gentler curve for the zipper to navigate, hopefully resulting in less wear and tear on the zipper. It also has more internal dividers and a slot for a key, SD card, and coins.

I've grown to really love the small zippered form factor.  I holds a lot, yet is tiny. My only complaint would be that cash must be triple folded to fit, but I carry only emergency cash in the wallet and use a money clip for the rest.
summary: Awesome little wallet. Holds a lot. Great warranty.

I received this product at the REGULAR price (no special discount). No payment was received to give a rating or to write a review. My ratings are purely based on my perception of how good the quality and features of a product are. I do not consider the usefulness of a product, as a customer would only buy an item which is useful/needed for them. I am an avid online shopper and realize the importance of reviews from other users. Thus, I take extreme care in offering the most fair review and rating possible.

If you found this review helpful, please give a Helpful Vote! If you have any questions about the product's quality, looks, features or anything else, simply make a comment and I will promptly respond. If you need pictures or videos of the product, I will be happy to provide them as well.

I have owned several pairs of Foster Grant sunglasses previous to these that were bought in the drugstore. I have had no problem with any of the others, but I had a bad skin reaction to this pair that I bought on Amazon. At least one of my other pairs of FGs have some sort of embellishment on the outside at the temple as these do. However, on these glasses differ in several ways from my other Foster Grants:

1) The embellishment is larger than any of the embellishments on my other glasses.
2) Instead of the embellishment being attached to the OUTSIDE of the stem, this heart goes THROUGH the stem. This means that the prongs holding the heart in are on the INSIDE of the glasses. This is what I thought was causing my skin irritation at first, but it was not.
3) There is about an inch-long thin metal plate inside the right stem of these glasses that hasn't existed in any of my other FGs.

I finally realized that it was the metal plate (#3) that was causing my skin irritation (a big welt on my face at the hairline, where the sunglass stem touches my face). I picked at it to see if I was able to remove it, and it came right off...apparently just glued on. I don't know the purpose of this piece of metal in the stem of the glasses, but it was a major source of irritation for me. Once removed, I could wear the glasses w/o irritation.

Since these were the first pair of Foster Grants I bought online, I did not realize how huge they are. The parts of the sunglasses that shield my eyes are MUCH larger than my other FGs. Because of this, the lower rim of the plastic lenses sits on my face. This is a problem for me because I sweat a LOT from the face when it's hot. As a result, I don't wear these FG sunglasses as much as my other remaining pair.

Of the four or so pair of Foster Grant sunglasses I've owned, these are probably my least favorite. Part of that is because they are so big on my face.
summary: If you are metal allergic/sensitive, beware. These glasses caused major skin irritation due to a small metal plate on the stem.

reviewText: Fit snuggly on my face/head.  Won't fall off while gardening, although not too tight.

Got these here for $9.99 on a lightning deal and I'm glad I did. Not only because they were under 10 bucks but because they look great. I usually hate oversized sunglasses because they seem to be associated with either little old ladies or movie stars trying to go incognito. Neither apply to me. And until now, have never had one that fit my face. I've tried about  a hundred oversized sunglasses and never could find a pair that I liked enough to buy so I had never EVER intended to ever buy one for myself (having long ago decided that the 'retired-to-Florida snowbird' look should be reserved only for actual snowbirds), but I needed a pair of sunglasses badly, and I REALLY didn't want to have to go to the mall just to get a pair. I figured, since I only need them for the 15 minutes it takes me to get to work, even if they didn't look good, for $10 and the convenience of not having to go to the mall, it would do.

And boy am I glad I did. They look really stylish on and they're comfortable (they don't pinch like cheap glasses have a tendency to do) even while being snug. I have really long eyelashes and they don't hit the lenses (which gets irritating fast) yet they still fit really well...high up on the nose.

I deducted a star because the big faux-gold hearts on the side look a tad cheap. They could have done without putting those on. Not EVERYTHING needs to be blinged out. Other than that, I love them and definitely recommend.
summary: My First Foster Grants...Won't Be My Last

All right, so this would be a five-star rating if the measurements provided were for the inside of the clutch.  It is a gorgeous little thing with sparkles to spare.  They are not kidding when they say it will sparkle under any light.

The evening bag is exactly as presented.  It is a straight-up silver and sparkle delight.  If you are looking for the "silver" rhinestones that have the rainbow reflections in them, this is not the bag for you.  Silver, silver, silver, glorious silver, that is what this is.

Literally, my only complaint is the measurements.  I measured my phone to ensure that it would fit into this purse, and according to the measurements listed, it should have.  Due to the rounded corners and lining or the purse, the inside has different measurements which means it was too small for my phone.  I did manage to fit my ID, debit card, lipstick and two Hotwheels cars in there though, so that is something.  If you have a larger phone or a "phablet", chances are it will not fit in this lovely bag.

reviewText: Fits the Pebble Steel perfectly.

I bought this as a band for my Pebble Steel in Stainless Steel.  I got it mostly so that I can wear my Pebble during exercising since sweat doesn't mix well with the leather band that came with the watch.  ***Also, this does NOT come with a screwdriver for changing the bands, contrary to other companies that do include one, like Truffol.

The good:
Well made, high quality silicone.
Width and length about the same as the original leather band.

The bad:
The silicone band for some reason picks up a lot more dust than my other silicone bands.  Not sure why that is.
The part of the band that connects to the watch are just a tad wider, so they don't fit into the grooves smoothly.  Instead, you have to jam them in.  The rod will slide through still and you can lock it in with a screwdriver.  However, because it is so rigid in there, there is less flexibility and your watch will not lay flat on the table or desk when you set it down.  The band will prop it up a bit.

Overall impression:
Pretty good band replacement for the Pebble Steel, but the connectors are a bit rigid and the band picks up too much dust.
Definitely what I needed. Cane quickly. Relatively easy to replace
A great addition for the Pebble Steel!!

reviewText:
Bought in a bit hastily when we found my wife's white clutch chewed up by our new puppy. It looked fine to me, but my wife clearly was not satisfied. It served us well for about one night for a fundraiser, and then my wife went straight to the store and bought more quality name-brand stuff. Clearly not high-quality, but if you're short on cash or you're just in need of a quick stand-in, I'd say this is a good choice.

Primary Complaint: The button looks worn down and damaged. Not a major complaint, but clearly testament to the "cheap" nature of this product. To women, they will swiftly identify the poor craftsmanship (warning guys: don't buy as a gift).

Primary Pro: From a distance and to men, looks quality.

Other thoughts: Super cheap, great for a quick fix.
summary: A great purse if you're in a pinch

First of all, delivery was relatively quick. I received it in about ten days or so. The jewelry is awesome! There are exactly 30 barbells in the package. Some of the little balls were loose, but there were no missing pieces at all. I had two duplicates, set one of them aside to give to a friend. I set another four barbells aside to also give away, but out of personal preference. I'm not a fan of pot leaves and there were three different pot leaf designs, one duplicate pot leaf. So I was left with a total of 25 tongue rings. All the graphics are clear and not tacky or cheap-looking at all. They look like graphic barbells you'd see at a Hot Topic or Spencer's. They're all really cool and I look forward to wearing them all. The reason why I rated 4 stars and not 5 is because I got 6 barbells that were a solid color and not a graphic design. Also, I was kind of looking forward to some of the designs shown in the picture like the Ariel one, and the brass knuckles and several others that I didn't recieve. But I mean, that's to be expected when there's a large variety of designs they randomly choose 30 of them to send Most of what I received wasn't even shown in the picture, but I love them. I got a tarantula, a Nike symbol, and just a bunch of random awesome ones. They look pretty clean, but I mean if you order something online that's gonna be in your mouth obviously you have to clean it well and sterilize it as a precaution. Overall, I did love them all for the most part. I would definitely recommend and I would definitely order it again just to see what other cool designs I may get.

I have three teenage girls--all of whom are regularly attending formal events.  This dress was purchased for homecoming and is one of the best-made dresses we have ever bought.  There is a great built in bra that has an independent adjustable backstrap, which helps because my daughter wears a size c cup but has a tiny waist. She's 5'4, 120# and the skirt tulle lands in the mid to lower thigh area. The size 6 fits her wonderfully. The color is a pretty lilac as the picture shows on our computer.
 As another review mentioned, the jeweled waist has fewer in number of jewels--it's the same general pattern only the jewels are much more spread out.  This is true for the bust jewels as well, but that isn't a problem because we anticipated adding craft store jewels to the skirt anyway so we'll just buy a few additional for the waist and bustline. The skirt is slightly different in "poof" compared to the picture.  Instead of being tutu like, ours is a bit more flowing.  For someone with a bigger bust, small waist, and bigger hips (think hourglass figure here) it is the perfect dress.  I wouldn't hesitate in recommending it.
Very  beautiful! My granddaughter looked like a princess for her homecoming dance!!!

I bought this dress hoping that the first review was wrong, and that she just received a bad dress- well she wasn't all that wrong. I bought a size 7 (my usual) which was smaller than the sizing chart suggested. Turns out its still too big! The lace up back turned out being less than an inch thick when tightened to my torso. The jewels on the waist band were also asymmetrical (spacing wise) as the original review had said, not to mention that there were about half the amount of jewels than what the dress has in the picture. The skirt was also way too poofy. I, for some strange reason, was thinking that the skirt wouldnt actually be that big, but in fact it was almost bigger. The one thing I did like though was the built in bra- with that, it felt as though the dress wasn't going to budge and felt better than wearing a strapless bra.

Ok, here's the thing. If you want a mask that you want to wear to keep the cold out, without doing any kind of physical activity that requires you to breath a bit more heavily (such as running, jumping, climbing, ect.) then I would recommend this mask. However, if you intend on playing airsoft, paintball, hunting, or just wearing in the event of a global catastrophe, do not buy this. The problem is that the material used to print the detailed "ghost" face on the mask inhibits any air flow in and out of the mask....which is a problem for people that like to breath comfortably.

reviewText:
The swimsuit came within two days of ordering. Prime membership pays off since I was going on vacation and needed this right away. I was hesitant on the size when I was ordering. I am a 34B, 5'7 and 135 pounds. I normally wear a medium and from the reviews, I was worried the sizes ran small. I took the chance and ended up ordering medium. The top creased a little bit during shipping, which I'm still trying to get it flat despite washing a few times. However, it is not too noticeable. The suit fit me perfectly. I do not have a big chest but I can see if people have a bigger chest, they might want to go with a bigger size. I wear a size 28-29 pants but the bottom fits perfectly.

The suit has no padding, and dries super fast due to the material. I would purchase again in a different color.

I bought a similar neoprene bikini from another seller on here and I like it much better than the Ebuddy one. This Ebuddy bikini runs much smaller in both the bottoms and the chest circumstance, both bikinis ordered in a Medium. And even though they look exactly the same, all the way down to the clear tag inside and exact stitching, Ebuddy is a VERY thick material - it's stiff and awkward and almost hard. The bottoms very much felt like a diaper and didn't flex well at all. They even made a weird noise in the bum while walking. Very strange. The bottoms are also very low cut in the front but almost too much coverage in the back. Not very flattering on me. The top fit ok - I have a small chest so I personally feel a little awkward not filling it out completely, but once I adjust the straps tighter at the shoulders, it moulds to my small shape a little better. These bikinis definitely look better on someone more blessed on top, which I am not.
The other seller's suit was still a quality neoprene, but MUCH softer and more form fitting and flexible. That all said, I can wear the Ebuddy top with my other black bikini bottoms (since the Ebuddy's are so funky) so it's a win I suppose. And for these low prices on these knock-off suits, I might even order a padded style set from another seller and just mix all the pieces.
The colors are really nice (black/white/neon yellow) and it's a very cute suit, it just fits so stinking weird.

reviewText: I was a little bit unsure what to expect when I first made the purchase of buying the swimsuit. After reading mixed reviews I didn't have my hopes up too high, so when I got the package, which debt arrived very quickly, I guess that it met my expectations. I expected the product to be a little bit tight, which it was, but not overwhelmingly small so that is something to keep in mind. Typically I fit into a medium swimsuit, and I decided to just continue with that size and buy this one in a medium, despite customer reviews and disappointment from other offbrand swimsuit Look-alikes that have tended to run quite small. I was not disappointed. Like I said, the fit was slightly small, but that does not to take away from the quality of the material. The colors have not yet faded but I have not wash the swimsuit, only let it air dry after a vacation. The colors are very true to the picture and are very bright. The bottoms are what run a little bit tight, but I am a 5 foot five teen who weighs a little less than 120 pounds. My bra size is a 32C in most cases, and I was very pleased with the fit of the top. Only one adjustment setting, but over all the cups fit nice on my breasts, but the front material is a little thin. I will probably be using padding from other similar swimsuit styles just to make sure that my nipples don't pop through. Then again, TMI, but my nipples pop through a lot of things when I'm not wearing padding, so if you don't have that problem you probably will be just fine. If I adjust the top correctly, there is no peep show though, so it just depends on the person and how their body is built! Overall a very good purchase and I would recommend to people, as the quality is fairly high and extremely similar to that of the Triangl brand.
summary: Overall, pretty impressed! Good quality, possibly a little tight, but beautiful color!

reviewText: Love this bikini!  The neoprene is a great quality and the colors are so vibrant.  I've worn this in the ocean, pool & have hand washed and the colors and quality have stayed the same.  It looks almost identical to the more expensive Triangl brand.  The bottoms do run a little small, but they still fit me fine (I ordered the Deep Blue in Small - I usually wear size XS/S tops and a size 4 in pants).  The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because I'm not a huge fan of the fastening in the back, I wish it could be made tighter but there is only one option.

This suit is well made; the colors pop, the materials are high quality and the style is indistinguishable from much more expensive brands. However, even in the largest size, it's still too small for my size 8 bottom. The neoprene has no give so it cuts off my hips, causing an unflattering bulge. The only inner tube I want at the beach is the one I float in while sipping my cocktail! I should have known better when other size 2-4 reviewers were ordering Larges. This suit is super cute and it makes me so sad to send it back, but unless you have a straighter more "boyish" figure or are very very fit, this may not be the suit for you.
summary: Lovely suit, if only it was built for curvier figures!

reviewText: Great product

PROS:
* It looks exactly like the picture, and the colors are vibrant and flow beautifully- I am pleased with the product.
* You could buy 4 of these for the price of an actual Triangl.
* It has a snap clip holding it in the back which is so convenient.
* The bathing suit top has adjustable and removable straps.
CONS
* I am a 34C cup and I'd say the top was a 34B, so it is a bit small. It's not padded, so it doesn't give me much cleavage (especially because of the design)
* I am a 2/4 or a 26 in bottoms- there was a very tiny gap on the pants because it doesn't fit perfectly to my body 100% because of the material
